description: 1) Write the Zeckendorf expression of n; 2) Remove initial 1 and append a final 0; 3) Replace numbers in this as follows: 0 -> 1, 010 -> 2, 01010 -> 3, 0101010 -> 4...; 4) Find a binary number with run lengths from step 3 (starting with 1); 5) The term a(n) is the decimal equivalent of this binary number.
comments: A permutation of the positive integers
example: a(18) = 26 because: 1) the Zeckendorf expression for 18 is 101000 (13 + 5) 2) this becomes 010000 3) 010 -> 2, 0 -> 1, 0 -> 1, 0 -> 1 4) 2 ones, 1 zero, 1 one, 1 zero: 11010 5) the binary number 11010 in decimal is 26.
author: Alex Fink (fink(AT)cadvision.com), Aug 27 2000
extensions: More terms from _David W. Wilson_, May 12 2001
